definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To place (objects) into a line (usually used with "up"); to form into a line; to align .
examples: They lined up the books against the wall.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To place persons or things along the side of for security or defense ; to strengthen by adding ; to fortify .
( transitive ) To form a line along.
( transitive ) To mark with a line or lines ; to cover with lines .
( rail transport ) To align (one or more switches ) to direct a train onto a particular track .
examples: The dispatcher lined the switches at Pickle interlocking for the freight turnout to clear the train into the passing track before the express arrived.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , obsolete ) To represent by lines ; to delineate ; to portray .
( transitive , dated , now more often line out ) To read or repeat line by line .
( intransitive , baseball ) To hit a line drive ; to hit a line drive which is caught for an out . Compare fly and ground .
examples: Jones lined to left in his last at-bat.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To track (wild bees) to their nest by following their line of flight .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To place (objects) into a line (usually used with "up"); to form into a line; to align .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To place persons or things along the side of for security or defense ; to strengthen by adding ; to fortify .

( transitive , dated , now more often line out ) To read or repeat line by line .
( intransitive , baseball ) To hit a line drive ; to hit a line drive which is caught for an out . Compare fly and ground .

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To cover the inner surface of (something), originally especially with linen .
examples: to line a cloak with silk or fur
to line a box with paper or tin
The bird lines its nest with soft grass.
Paintings lined the walls of the cavernous dining room.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To fill or supply (something), as a purse with money.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To cover the inner surface of (something), originally especially with linen .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To fill or supply (something), as a purse with money.

definitions.label_groups: transitive , now rare , of a dog

main_definition: ( transitive , now rare , of a dog ) To copulate with, to impregnate .
